majorBranches.name: Foundations
majorBranches.description: Fundamental concepts, logic, and set theory that underpin all of mathematics.

subBranches.name: Logic
subBranches.description: Study of reasoning and valid inference.

subBranches.name: Proof Theory
subBranches.description: Study of mathematical proofs as formal objects.

majorBranches.name: Algebra
majorBranches.description: Study of mathematical symbols and the rules for manipulating these symbols.

subBranches.name: Abstract Algebra
subBranches.description: Study of algebraic structures such as groups, rings, fields, and modules.

subBranches.name: Linear Algebra
subBranches.description: Study of vector spaces, linear transformations, and systems of linear equations.

subBranches.name: Number Theory
subBranches.description: Study of the properties and relationships of integers.

majorBranches.name: Analysis
majorBranches.description: Branch of mathematics dealing with continuity, limits, derivatives, integrals, and related concepts.

subBranches.name: Real Analysis
subBranches.description: Rigorous study of real numbers, sequences, series, and functions.

subBranches.name: Complex Analysis
subBranches.description: Study of functions of complex variables.

subBranches.name: Functional Analysis
subBranches.description: Study of vector spaces endowed with a limit-related structure and the linear operators acting upon these spaces.

rulesForExpansion: New specialties must clearly fall under an existing Level 2 sub-branch.
New sub-branches should logically group related specialties and fall under an existing Level 1 major branch.
Adding a new Level 1 major branch requires demonstrating its distinct foundational concepts and broad scope within mathematics.
